newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Swiss Life (Belgium) pleased with INCA results.
newsitem.headline: Swiss Life (Belgium) pleased with INCA results.

text.p: Swiss Life's Swiss Life (Belgium) unit said on Wednesday it was satisfied with the performance of its Credit Agricole/Landbouwkrediet (INCA/NILK) banking unit.
Swiss Life (Belgium) bought a 37.45 percent stake in INCA, a rural Belgian bank, in 1995.
"We knew we would have a low dividend in the first few years," Louis Durieux, who takes over from Jean-Pierre Troussel as Swiss Life (Belgium) Director General on March 1, told a news conference.
INCA is due to release 1996 earnings on March 6.

"Profits are entirely satisfying our expectations," Durieux said. "They will allow Landbouwkrediet to recapitalise partly and put aside funds for difficult times which banks are facing, for instance when the euro is introduced."
